rationale: The mobile app enables users to scan the QR code and select items, JavaBrew Software processes the transactions, and the Wallet facilitates payment.
The Dashboard allows admins to monitor statistics and sales, while JavaBrew Software manages overall vending operations.
The mobile app enables user registration and login, connecting to the JavaBrew Software for account details.
The mobile app facilitates wallet recharges, working with the JavaBrew Software for processing transactions.
The Dashboard allows admins to manage and configure machines, while JavaBrew Software handles backend updates and configurations.
JavaBrew Software allows admins to perform CRUD operations for users, distributors, and items.
This use case does not involve any architectural components as it describes a generic maintenance process.
This use case is a generic description template and does not correspond to specific components.
The mobile app manages user login and connects to JavaBrew Software for authentication.
The mobile app handles the user login process, which interfaces with the JavaBrew Software for credential validation.
The mobile app allows customers to buy items, while JavaBrew Software processes the transactions.
The mobile app allows customers to recharge their accounts, working with the JavaBrew Software for transaction handling.
The mobile app connects users to the vending machines via the system's backend (JavaBrew Software).
The mobile app facilitates the buying process, JavaBrew Software validates transactions, and the Wallet handles payments.
The app allows customers to choose payment methods for recharging, JavaBrew Software processes the transactions, and the Wallet manages funds.
Workers view task details through the system managed by JavaBrew Software.
Workers mark tasks as completed in the system, which is handled via JavaBrew Software.
Workers complete tasks in the system, recorded and managed by JavaBrew Software.
The Dashboard provides analytics for admins, backed by data provided from JavaBrew Software.
Admin management of workers is facilitated through JavaBrew Software.
Admin management of vending machines is executed via the JavaBrew Software.
Task assignment by admins is managed through JavaBrew Software.
Viewing tasks is facilitated through the JavaBrew Software for admin access.
Admins create new vending machines using the Dashboard interface, interfacing with JavaBrew Software for backend operations.
Customer access to dashboards is facilitated through the Dashboard component.
Workers access their dashboard through the Dashboard component.
Admins access their dashboards via the Dashboard component.
Customers view their balance through interactions with JavaBrew Software.
Transaction history is accessed by customers through JavaBrew Software.
Checkout processing is done through interactions with JavaBrew Software.
Workers select tasks via the Dashboard, which integrates with the backend system.
Admins view analytics through their Dashboard.
This use case is a schema description and lacks relevant components.
Tracking connections between users and machines is managed through JavaBrew Software.
The remote maintenance feature is handled by the JavaBrew Software to enable technical actions.
